faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: How do I add AlphaLLM to my Discord server?
faq.a1: Click the "Add to Discord" button on our homepage and follow the instructions.
faq.a2: The main commands are /chat for conversation, /image for generating images, and /help to get assistance.
faq.q3: Is the bot free to use?
faq.a3: Yes, AlphaLLM offers a free plan with basic features. Premium plans are available for more features.
faq.q4: How do I change the bot's language?
faq.a4: Use the /settings language command to change the bot's language in your server.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.description: Couldn't find what you were looking for? Send us a message.

legalsPage.title: Legal Notices
legalsPage.subtitle: Terms of service and legal information for AlphaLLM

liability.title: Liability Limitation
liability.content: The manager makes every effort to ensure the proper functioning of the bot, but cannot be held responsible for inappropriate use, malfunction, or data loss.

acceptance.title: Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content: By using the AlphaLLM Discord bot, you agree to comply with these terms of service and all applicable laws. If you do not agree to these terms, you must not use the bot.

purpose.title: Purpose
purpose.content: The bot offers features related to artificial intelligence, including text conversation, image generation, and other associated services.

usage.title: Acceptable Use
usage.intro: You agree not to use the bot for:
usage.item4: Violating copyright or intellectual property rights
usage.item6: Deliberately overloading the bot or servers

content.title: Generated Content
content.description: Content generated by the bot may contain errors or biases. The user is responsible for the use of the content. The manager may suspend access in case of abusive use.

modifications.title: Service Modifications
modifications.content: The manager may modify, suspend, or terminate services at any time without notice.

termination.title: Termination
termination.content: The manager may terminate or suspend access in case of violation of terms or abusive use.

collection.title: Information Collection
collection.intro: The bot collects the following data:
collection.item2: Server ID, server name, owner username
collection.item3: Messages containing a mention of the bot
collection.item4: Results of optional surveys submitted to the user

usage.title: Data Usage
usage.content: This data is used for statistics, technical improvement of the bot, and support.

legalBasis.title: Legal Basis
legalBasis.content: Implied consent through use of the bot.

retention.title: Retention
retention.content: Logs and messages submitted to the bot are retained for approximately 1 month.

userRights.title: User Rights
userRights.content: Users can request access, modification, or deletion of their data via the contact indicated in the legal notices.

dataTransmission.title: Data Transmission
dataTransmission.content: No data is transmitted to third parties.

complaint.title: Complaint
complaint.content: In case of disagreement, the user can contact the CNIL (www.cnil.fr).

exceptions.title: Exceptions
exceptions.content: These provisions apply except for legal exceptions or requests from competent authorities.

errorPage.title: Error 404

discord.title: Discord Server
discord.description: Join our Discord community for help and to chat with other users.

contact.title: Direct Contact
contact.description: Have a specific question? Contact our support team directly.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: How do I invite AlphaLLM to my server?
faq.a1: To invite AlphaLLM to your Discord server, simply click the "Invite" button at the top of the homepage. You'll be redirected to Discord where you can select the server and necessary permissions. Make sure you have administrator rights on the server where you want to add the bot.
faq.a2: Yes, AlphaLLM is completely free to use with all its features. We don't offer a premium version at the moment. Our goal is to make AI accessible to all Discord users without financial barriers.
faq.q3: How do I configure the bot on my server?
faq.a3: After inviting the bot, use the /setup command to access the configuration menu. You can set the default chat channel, permissions, and other settings. For more advanced configuration, you can also use our web dashboard by logging in with your Discord account.
faq.a4: AlphaLLM offers several advanced AI models, including ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, Mistral, LLaMA, and others. You can choose your preferred model with the /model command or set a default model for your server in the settings.
faq.q5: How do I generate images with the bot?
faq.a5: To generate images, use the /imagine command followed by your description. You can specify different styles and aspect ratios. For example: /imagine an enchanted forest with glowing fairies, style:fantasy ratio:16:9
faq.q6: How do I limit bot access on my server?
faq.a6: You can limit bot access to specific roles or channels via the /permissions command or in the dashboard settings. You can also set usage quotas to prevent abuse.
faq.q7: I found a bug, how do I report it?
faq.a7: You can report bugs on our Discord server in the #bug-reports channel or by contacting our support team directly via email. Please provide as much detail as possible, such as steps to reproduce the issue, screenshots, and context.

hero.title: AlphaLLM Documentation
hero.subtitle: Complete guide to master the Discord AI bot

installation.title: Installation and Configuration
installation.content: To add AlphaLLM to your Discord server, click the "Invite" button from the homepage. Grant the necessary permissions for the bot to function properly.

chat.title: /chat
chat.description: Start a conversation with the AI. Example: /chat message="Hello, how are you?"

image.title: /image
image.description: Generate images from a description. Example: /image prompt="A cat in space"

search.title: /search
search.description: Search for information via AI. Example: /search query="What is AI?"

models.title: Available Models
models.content: AlphaLLM supports multiple AI models. Check the homepage for the complete list.

q1.question: The bot isn't responding?
q1.answer: Check permissions and ensure the bot is online (see Status page).

q2.question: How to change model?
q2.answer: Use the /model command to select a specific model.
